messages: Hey, good morning! I barely slept last night. My mind was all over the place.
I think work has been stressing me out a bit too much lately.
I have this big product launch next Friday, and I’m feeling the pressure.
Also, I’ve been drinking so much coffee these days… probably not great for my anxiety.
By the way, I absolutely love Italian food, especially creamy mushroom pasta.
Music helps me calm down — I usually listen to soft lo-fi or jazz in the evenings.
My sister Riya keeps telling me to pick up meditation again, but I’m too inconsistent.
I try to go for morning walks, but I skip them whenever I feel overwhelmed.
Oh, and I’m planning a short trip to Goa next month with a few friends.
I really enjoy beaches; they make me feel peaceful and disconnected from work stress.
Sometimes I feel like I’m not doing enough in life, even though people say I’m doing fine.
I’ve been trying to learn Spanish for the past year, but I keep forgetting vocabulary.
My birthday is on March 18, so I might take a day off and just relax.
I'm quite introverted, but once I’m comfortable, I talk a lot.
I don’t like loud parties — they drain me faster than a whole week of work.
I prefer cozy cafés or quiet dinners with close friends.
One annoying thing is that I’m allergic to peanuts, so I always check ingredients.
Do you think journaling helps? I’ve been thinking of starting a small nightly routine.
Whenever I talk about deadlines, I get this tight feeling in my chest — it’s weird.
But when I’m reading fiction, especially mystery novels, I feel totally relaxed.
My favorite author right now is Haruki Murakami — his writing feels dreamy.
Oh, and I recently adopted a cat! Her name is Luna; she’s super playful.
My apartment is pretty small, but it feels cozy with Luna around.
Most weekends, I prefer staying in and cooking something simple.
I enjoy photography too — mostly landscapes and street shots.
One of my long-term goals is to move abroad for a year, maybe Spain or Japan.
I get emotionally overwhelmed when people raise their voice at me.
But I’m very supportive to my friends — they come to me whenever they need advice.
By the way, my phone battery dies ridiculously fast, and it annoys me daily.
Anyway, thanks for listening. It feels good to just talk without being judged.
